channel.title: Dumb Question
channel.description: I know this is a dumb cuestion, but what the heck are client.java and the stuff, and were can i get it :confused:

item.title: Dumb Question
item.dc:creator: @csrsniper254 csrsniper254
item.description:
@csrsniper254 wrote:

Actually it has not been fully answered there is still the matter of where it is located.

To download a server source go here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,49.0.html once you have found a source you like download it and then unzip the file. (remember to extract it to itself) once opened you should see something like this:
Within this is your client.java file.

item.title: Dumb Question
item.dc:creator: @csrsniper254 csrsniper254
item.description:
@csrsniper254 wrote:

sgt caleb. Spamming is against the rules.

In response to leder:

Q: What is client.java?
A: In the words of mod taharok it is:
Ok first off is the client.java. The purpose of this is to put together all of the skins and models together into code for the java compiler to compile. It is pretty much the main source file (but not the full thing; only about 35% of the source.) It is fairly easy to edit it. When someone says “declare” scomthing, then you need to put it with the rest of that type (I.E. someone wants you t declare “public void hi()”, then you would search “public void” until you see public voids whose code is similar to the one your supposed to add. Now just add it with one of those and your done.) If you want to fully save settings, then you save
the file and then click “compile.bat” to compile the .class file. I pretty much summed everything up. Also, if someone doesnt say declare but does not show or say where to put it, then declare it yourself (and when you are declaring a case, then put it after the case bfore it [I.E. case 24 would be declared after case 23].)

Read full topic
